abstract: Lazard disclosed that Vernon E. Jordan, a confidante of former President Bill Clinton who is a member of its board and a senior managing director of Lazard Frères & Company, saw his total compensation climb to $3.7 million last year, from $3.04 million reported for 2008.

lead_paragraph: 5:01 p.m. | Updated Need another sign that Wall Street is on the upswing? Just look at the preliminary proxy that Lazard filed late Friday afternoon with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: Vernon Jordan Gets a Big Payday From Lazard
